intro: Lessingia ramulosa var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are small, white or pale pink, often arranged in clusters. This variety is distinguished by its smaller flower heads compared to the typical form of Lessingia ramulosa.
